sounds like the drives got renumbered.. I actually thought ubuntu's use of uuids would prevent problems like this.. but I wouldn't say I'm surprised something like this happens
how can i fix it?
should i boot from cd with the HDDs connected, then list the HDDs to see which is which, then confirm grub says the right drive for boot?

tougher question =)  I would start looking at reconfiguring the raid drives.. say you previously had /dev/sda1, /dev/sdb1 and /dev/sdc1 in a raid5 config.. your new drive became the new /dev/sda1 so you would have to change the raid to use /dev/sdb1, /dev/sdc1 and /dev/sdd1
you might want to be careful about how you do this.. you don't want to reinitialize the raid volume ie erase everything and start again.. make sure you know what the commands you run actually do
